snippet: The effort to remove three jurists from the State Supreme Court swayed voters despite having no single rallying issue — an encouraging development for activists targeting the judiciary.
abstract: Failed effort to remove three liberal justices from Tennessee State Supreme Court sways voters despite lack of single rallying issue, an encouraging development for conservative groups and business interests targeting the judiciary; conservatives in states across nation, looking at courts as outlet to augment their public policy pursuits, have transformed monotonous judicial elections into full-throated campaigns.
lead_paragraph: The effort to remove three jurists from the State Supreme Court swayed voters despite having no single rallying issue — an encouraging development for activists targeting the judiciary.

headline.main: Despite Failure, Campaign to Oust Tennessee Justices Keeps Conservatives Hopeful
headline.print_headline: Despite Failure, Campaign to Oust Tennessee Justices Keeps Conservatives Hopeful
